description: [Status: stable] [Name: invalid-all-format] [Message: Invalid format for __all__, must be tuple or list] What it does Checks for invalid assignments to __all__. Why is this bad? In Python, __all__ should contain a sequence of strings that represent the names of all "public" symbols exported by a module. Assigning anything other than a tuple or list of strings to __all__ is invalid. Example __all__ = "Foo" Use instead: __all__ = ("Foo",)
